title: "Retiring dominion"
body:
"it's easier for us to keep kids addicted to one queue type and the idea of becoming pro rift players, so we'll remove other game modes since they pose the threat of breaking kids addiction to the idea of becoming "pro" and thus risk them moving on to more complex and fun games"

Riot gotta continue that viscous cycle, they pay some "pro" players some money, AKA Riot's advertising team, to keep the kiddies addicted.

replies.body:
They are removing it because less than 0.5% of the playerbase plays Dominion.

Are they removing ARAM? No, because it's actually popular.
Are they removing Twisted Treeline? No it's actually popular.

NO ONE PLAYS DOMINION!
^ This. Even on NA, ques for Dominion took forever (que times have dropped now, due to the retirement and people trying to cram for the icon)
